note: P. Taylor: Radical Historian of Europe (London, 2006); the readable study by Adam Sisman, A. J. P. Taylor: A Biography (London, 1994); and the well-informed account by one of Taylor’s PhD students, Kathleen Burk, Troublemaker: The Life and History of A. J. P. Taylor (London, 2000). Jonathan Haslam, The Vices of Integrity: E. H. Carr, 1892–1982 (London, 1999), by one of Carr’s PhD students, is psychologically acute and intellectually penetrating.
